    • updatePressureFromMomentumBalance

      private void updatePressureFromMomentumBalance()
      Updates the pressure profile along the pipe using a simple integrated momentum balance.

      This avoids solving a separate density-based "pressure" equation that can otherwise keep the pressure nearly constant in steady-state runs. Handles both single-phase and two-phase flows.

    • initVelocity

    • checkPhaseTransitions

      public int checkPhaseTransitions()
      Check for phase transitions at each node by performing TPflash. Returns the maximum number of phases found across all nodes. If a new phase is detected, the node is re-initialized for two-phase flow.
      Returns:
      maximum number of phases found (1 or 2)

      phaseNum - a int

    • setEnergyMatrixTDMA

      public void setEnergyMatrixTDMA(int phaseNum)

      setEnergyMatrixTDMA.

      This method implements the energy conservation equation for two-phase pipe flow. The energy equation includes:

      • Convective enthalpy transport
      • Wall heat transfer (with proper heat transfer coefficient)
      • Interphase heat transfer
      • Joule-Thomson effect (temperature change due to pressure drop)
      • Latent heat from phase change (evaporation/condensation)
      • Gravitational potential energy changes
      Parameters:
      phaseNum - a int

    • setComponentConservationMatrix2

    • getMassTransferSummary

      public double[] getMassTransferSummary()
      Get the total mass transfer summary for all components. Useful for validating complete dissolution or evaporation.
      Returns:
      Array containing [totalDissolution, totalEvaporation, netTransfer] in moles

    • getComponentMassTransferProfile

      public double[] getComponentMassTransferProfile(int componentNumber)
      Get the mass transfer for a specific component across all nodes.
      Parameters:
      componentNumber - The component index
      Returns:
      Array of transfer values for each node [mol]

    • isGasPhaseCompletelyDissolved

      public boolean isGasPhaseCompletelyDissolved()
      Check if the gas phase has been completely dissolved. Useful for validating total dissolution scenarios.
      Returns:
      true if gas phase moles are below the threshold at the outlet

    • isLiquidPhaseCompletelyEvaporated

      public boolean isLiquidPhaseCompletelyEvaporated()
      Check if the liquid phase has been completely evaporated. Useful for validating total evaporation scenarios.
      Returns:
      true if liquid phase moles are below the threshold at the outlet

    • getSinglePhaseNodeIndices

      public int[] getSinglePhaseNodeIndices()
      Get indices of nodes where a phase has disappeared. Returns empty array if all nodes have two phases.
      Returns:
      Array of node indices where one phase is absent

    • getNodeMassTransferRate

      public double getNodeMassTransferRate(int nodeIndex, int componentNumber)
      Get the mass transfer rate at a specific node for a given component.
      Parameters:
      nodeIndex - The node index
      componentNumber - The component index
      Returns:
      Mass transfer rate [mol/s] (positive = dissolution, negative = evaporation)

    • validateMassTransferAgainstLiterature

      public String validateMassTransferAgainstLiterature()
      Validate the mass transfer against literature correlations. Compares calculated Sherwood numbers against expected ranges.
      Returns:
      ValidationResult containing pass/fail and diagnostic messages

    • getMassBalanceError

      public double getMassBalanceError()
      Get mass balance error for diagnostics. Compares inlet and outlet total moles accounting for transfer.
      Returns:
      Relative mass balance error (should be near zero for converged solution)
